design_audit.n_clusters: ~356 polygons in tmt 1+2 (exact count determined at runtime)

claim_object.outcome_concept: Property tax compliance (binary: whether property tax was paid)
claim_object.treatment_concept: Local chief-led tax collection vs central/state-led collection
claim_object.estimand_concept: ITT effect of assigning neighborhood to local (chief) collection on individual property tax compliance probability
claim_object.target_population: Property owners in Kananga, Kasai Central, D.R. Congo (excluding villas, pilot polygons, and properties with missing rate information)

baseline_specs.label: Table4-Revenues-Col4
baseline_specs.notes: Continuous revenue amount; intensive margin complement to compliance binary

constraints.functional_form_scope: rc/form/outcome/log1p_amt and rc/form/outcome/asinh_amt apply ONLY to baseline__revenues (taxes_paid_amt). They are not applicable to the binary taxes_paid outcome.
constraints.treatment_definition_scope: rc/data/treatment/include_cli_arm, include_cxl_arm, and pooled_local_vs_central change the sample restriction (broadening beyond inlist(tmt,1,2)) and/or redefine the treatment indicator. These are estimand-preserving only if the ITT interpretation is extended to the broader comparison set.
constraints.notes: RCT design: no covariates in the baseline specification. The paper progressively adds FE (stratum, month, house type) but no individual-level controls in Table 4. The only individual controls appear in Table 5 mechanism regressions. Control-count envelope is [0,0] for this group.

canonical.notes: Cluster SEs at neighborhood (polygon) level, matching the randomization unit. Used throughout Table 4 except Col 3 (polygon means).

variants.notes: Robust SEs without clustering. Used only for polygon-mean specification (Table 4 Col 3) where N = number of polygons.

diagnostics_plan.notes: Table 3 balance test across treatment arms (regression of baseline/midline covariates on treatment dummies with stratum FE and clustering at a7)
Table 3 attrition analysis (baseline-to-endline attrition and midline attrition differential by arm)
